attributes.action: arrange a refendum that gives UK taxpayers the opportunity to have a say in the decision on the most appropriate pay and remuneration package for our representatives.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
* The Committee of Standards in Public Life should deliver a number of alternative pay and expenses packages that are capable of being posed as questions in the referendum.

* MPs should not be permitted to vote on their own pay and expenses package until the result of this referendum has become known.

* Such a move would mean that MPs would be 'informed' what package to vote for, one that is acceptable to a majority of UK taxpayers.

* If our MPs are permitted to vote on a new pay and expenses package without this referendum the current climate of self-interest and lack of oversight will be perpetuated.

* This measure can and will force some integrity and oversight into the system and ensure that we the people take a measure of responsibility for our politicians.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
